title: How did Pythagoras find the Pythagorean theorem? - Quora

response.answer_text: How did Pythagoras find the Pythagorean theorem? He didn’t. Pythagoras’s theorem was known before Pythagoras. Pythagoras might have been the first to prove it, but even that is doubtful. We know very little about Pythagoras.

Take a right angled triangle which has base length ‘a’, height length ‘b’, and the side that joins them (hypotenuse) of length c.  Now consider a square consisting of four of these triangles:  The area of the whole square is quite obviously [math](a+b)^2 = A[/math] Now it becomes quite clear to see that the same area is also equal to the area of four of those triangles and the square in the middle, hence : [math]A= (4*(ab)/2) + c^2[/math] As the two areas are equal, we can simplify and solve: [math]a^2+2ab+b^2=2ab+c^2[/math] Subtract 2ab: [math]a^2+b^2=c^2[/math] And fini. That is one of many ways to show it and I believe that to be my favouite one of all.
